column5: Well, we decided to get back out on the river this evening in search of some atlantics. On the water by 6:30 and on the first pass the rigger right in front of me doubles over. I set the hook and hand it off to Mike at the front of the boat. 10 minutes later he lands this beauty.      We reset the lines but can't seem to hook up for the next half hour or so. We decide to go try a few different spots on the american side with soft jerkbaits rather than trolling. First drift we witness a fierce feeding frenzy and reposition just above for a cast. All three of us cast and I am lucky enough to hook up with another good fish.      A drift or two later, I get a follow and then quickly pitch the plastic out again and hook up with another chromer.    The next several drifts results in no fish but we do get a few follows and hits keeping us on our toes. Soon enough, Ted hooks up with what is the biggest fish of the evening coming in at just under 31 inches.        We had planned on staying for walleye but we had to pull the pin due to being low on fuel. Ah well, back at it in a day or two!  All fish released. I hope you enjoyed!  TDunn
some great fish there tyler. awesome report!
those are some solid fish!
Nice Eaters. Wish I could get a few of those on the smoker, then on a cracker.
Man I wish that it wasn't so darn far away awesome report
Amazing fish. Must be fun to get them on soft plastic jerkbaits. Great job guys.
Fantastic report, Tyler. They really are a beautiful fish but much larger where you are. Ours seem to all be in the 2-5lb range. Thanks for sharing.
Very impressive fishery you have there! And to catch fish like that casting in the summer is a double bonus! Thanks for sharing!

Im heading up there tomorrow morning bright and early Shawn, first time up that way....four days of fishing the river...and some back lake brookies!  Just had to check in here to see if you had posted another report TDunn, good to see there still hitting! Cant wait till tomorrow!
solid man...i should make a trip down just to fish
Buddy - those are some awesome lookin' fish!  I'd love to hit them up someday!  Keep the reports commin'!  cheers, Ryan
Awesome report! That looks like it would be a flippin riot! Lookin forward to your next report! HH

Brettiop - keep an eye out for me. I should be out weds or thurs. Good luck with your trip man, I hope you guys hook into a few!  Urban Fisherman - Ryan you know your welcome anytime!  Thanks to all the rest of the replies!  TDunn
Will do, we'll be etiher in a red Astro bass boat, or a brown Princecraft!  We have six coming up now instead of just 3, so hopefully will have a big fish pot i can try and win!

right on man. i've been working on manitoulin island for a week and dying to get back on the river.  i'll be back in town tomorrow and after a few days up north bass fishing, i'll be hitting the river hard for salmo.  send me a msg if you're ever looking for a dance partner.

very nice fishing up your way right now, congrats! That male sure looks like a Brown except the dots are mostly on the dorsal side of the lateral line.  how long do they stay near the river now? They don't run until September, no?
The best bite lasts until the chinooks show up in august but they are present in the river year round. You can catch them right until the boat goes away.....  TDunn

you headin to the river too eh? i'll be out there myself! tomorrow im makin a little whitefish stop then after that the boat is goin into the water. thursday is gunna be spent on the river and friday and saturday will be on a nice little speck lake  ...
Great report and pics, they truly are an amazing fish of beauty, congrads on your great fishery
I'm so jealous you guys have such an amazing fishery up there, almost makes me want to move up there. Any hot women up there in the Sault?? LOL  Great report guys
Very cool to be able to cast at 'em with soft jerkbaits!  Great looking bunch of atlantics guys!  Tony
Yep, fishing with Mr. Dunn is on my bucket list.
Awesome TDunn!!! Congrats
